column3: Improve the effectiveness of customs operations with single window initiatives
column4: Improving Trade Facilitation (Simplification, Harmonization and Standardization of Trade Procedures)
column40: Faster clearance for international trade and improved time performance of supply chains. Improving supply chain security, such as with the use of scanning technologies. Cross-border agreements to develop cross-border logistics (land border).
column41: Cybersecurity and hacking

column3: Coordinate customs operations with trusted importers and exporters
column4: Improving Trade Facilitation (Simplification, Harmonization and Standardization of Trade Procedures)
column40: Reduction in the number of inspections for imported cargo and faster clearance. Exemptions from random non-intrusive inspections. Improved level of service for customs.
column41: Two tiers system in customs clearance. Decline in compliance

column3: Create special customs zones
column4: Improving Trade Facilitation (Simplification, Harmonization and Standardization of Trade Procedures)
column40: Promotion of exports. Flexibility in the use of national customs regulations. Attract internationally focused logistics activities.
column41: Loss of duty income. Infractions in customs regulations.

column3: Expand the ease to move cargo between customs entities within the same country.
column4: Improving Trade Facilitation (Simplification, Harmonization and Standardization of Trade Procedures)
column40: Better integration between major gateways such as ports and airports. Additional flexibility in supply chain management.
column41: Loss of customs duty income. Infractions in customs regulations.

column3: Develop gateways (ports and airports) as locations of national strategic interest.
column4: Improving the Global Interface of Logistics (Gateways, Corridors, and Hinterland Accessibility
column40: Improve the capacity and throughput of ports or airports (new or existing facilities). Identify and coordinate transport infrastructure investment in gateway area. Facilitate modal shift and effective inland freight distribution.
column41: Competing national gateways. Duplication of infrastructure.

column3: Open terminal facilities to private terminal operators.
column4: Improving the Global Interface of Logistics (Gateways, Corridors, and Hinterland Accessibility
column40:
Improve the productivity of terminal operations by concessioning to
private terminal operators. PPP where private operator investing in terminal equipment and
automation. Better connectivity to global maritime shipping.
Use and coordinate regional transportation more effectively.
column41:
Loss of control in terminal development.
Reduction in employment due to efficiency improvements.
Profit from terminal operation may be expatriated.

column3: Privatize public terminals, transporters or distributors.
column4: Improving the Global Interface of Logistics (Gateways, Corridors, and Hinterland Accessibility
column40: Improve the efficiency of the privatized firms. Enables the entry of new providers. Increase competitiveness.
column41:
Reduction in employment due to efficiency improvements.
Profit may be expatriated.

column3: Develop or expand key transport connectors between logistical activities (e.g. terminals and logistics zones).
column4: Improving the Global Interface of Logistics (Gateways, Corridors, and Hinterland Accessibility
column40: Improve key capacity bottlenecks. Coordinate the operations and investments of various stakeholders. Improve hinterland transport capacity, efficiency, and reliability. Facilitate better asset utilization and modal shift.
column41: Duplication of connectors.

column3: Develop zones supporting logistics activities.
column4: Providing a Land Base for Logistics Infrastructure and Activities (Logistics Zones and Inland Ports)
column40: Achieves economies of agglomeration for freight activities. Lowers operational costs (e.g. joint infrastructures and utilities). Promotes the setting of logistics services firms.
column41:
Duplication of logistics parks.
Designed function of the park not meeting market demands.

column3: Develop logistics zones adjacent to port terminal facilities.
column4: Providing a Land Base for Logistics Infrastructure and Activities (Logistics Zones and Inland Ports)
column40: Uses port real estate more effectively. Facilitates imports and exports (direct access to port terminal). Reduces local congestion.
column41:
Higher land values pressure the returns on investment.
Impact on surrounding communities.

column3: Develop facilities for users to pick up and drop containers outside terminals.
column4: Providing a Land Base for Logistics Infrastructure and Activities (Logistics Zones and Inland Ports)
column40: Ensures availability of containers for exporters. Reduces port congestion. Lowers drayage costs.
column41: Improper location. Lack of demand.

column3: Develop inland intermodal facilities connected to gateways.
column4: Providing a Land Base for Logistics Infrastructure and Activities (Logistics Zones and Inland Ports)
column40: Promotes modal shift (if connected by rail or barge). Reduces port congestion (relocation of some port activities). Facilitates economies of scale in inland distribution (corridors). Lowers last mile transport costs (co-location).
column41:
Duplication of inland ports.
Facility underused.

column3: Promotes logistics as a career path and expand capabilities (technical training).
column4: Developing Logistics Capabilities (Labour and Logistical Services Skills)
column40: Provide a labour pool to address expected demand. Increases labour productivity. Develops diversified skills. Attracts logistics firms.
column41:
Lack of labour (quantitative and qualitative).
Develop unneeded capabilities.

column3: Create research capabilities to address supply chain challenges.
column4: Developing Logistics Capabilities (Labour and Logistical Services Skills)
column40: Identify trends, gaps and opportunities. Train researchers, consultants and managers. Provide innovations suitable for the national market. Collaborate with logistics firms.
column41: Politically biased research.

column3: Supports the development of small and medium-sized logistics firms.
column4: Developing Logistics Capabilities (Labour and Logistical Services Skills)
column40: Develop entrepreneurial capabilities, particularly for new firms. Improve the provision of specialized logistics services, such as 3PLs and 4PLs. Improve the competitiveness of the logistics market.
column41:
Focus on politically connected firms.
Potential bias towards sectors favoured by policy as opposed to those
with market potential.

column3: Create an exchange market for logistics services.
column4: Supporting Logistical Information Systems (Freight Portals / Port Community Systems)
column40: Improves the interactions between the providers and consumers of logistics services. Promotes a better usage of transport assets and facilities. Enables the participation of small and medium-sized firms.
column41: Creation of a two-tier market for logistics services.

column3: Make available logistical information among the actors involved in portrelated freight distribution.
column4: Supporting Logistical Information Systems (Freight Portals / Port Community Systems)
column40:
Promotes competitiveness in port-related services.
Promotes coordination between freight actors to improve port area
efficiency.
Improves the tracking of freight and transport assets.
column41: Cybersecurity and hacking

column3: Monitor logistics activities by collecting and providing data.
column4: Supporting Logistical Information Systems (Freight Portals / Port Community Systems)
column40: Collects information about logistics activities. Reports key performance indicators benchmarking the industry. Assesses the effectiveness of logistics policies.
column41: Information inaccurate or biased.

column3: Assists the certification of firms and products to global environmental standards.
column4: Developing Niche Logistics (Infrastructures and Services Promoting Sustainable Comparative Advantages)
column40: Improve environmental impacts of logistics. Certified carriers (less emissions; energy efficiency). Certified distribution facilities (energy efficiency; lower footprint). Reduces material losses.
column41: Compliance and certification costs.

column3: Develop capabilities to handle refrigerated cargo.
column4: Developing Niche Logistics (Infrastructures and Services Promoting Sustainable Comparative Advantages)
column40: Promotes high-value exports of perishables (fish, meat, fruits, vegetables, flowers, etc.) on global markets in reefers. Ensures higher quality exports and less waste.
column41: Maintaining the integrity of the cold chain.

column3: Provides facilities to load or unload commodities in containers.
column4: Developing Niche Logistics (Infrastructures and Services Promoting Sustainable Comparative Advantages)
column40: Promotes specialized commodity exports. Expand market opportunities for small and medium-sized producers.
column41: Fluctuations in the commodity markets.

column3: Develop recycling and reuse supply chains.
column4: Developing Niche Logistics (Infrastructures and Services Promoting Sustainable Comparative Advantages)
column40: Improves efficient recovery of recycled materials. Develop and expand the national recycling industry. Help meet sustainability goals.
column41: Impact on national resource providers.

column3: Change the conditions in which urban deliveries take place (time of day, area, access to parking).
column4: Improving Last Mile Logistics (City Logistics)
column40: Improves use of existing transport assets. Matches trip sequences (deliveries and pickups). Reduces congestion.
column41: Additional delivery costs and delays.

column3: Facilities adapted to urban freight distribution.
column4: Improving Last Mile Logistics (City Logistics)
column40: Promotes consolidation, sorting and deconsolidation in high density urban areas. Improves efficiency (time and energy) of urban deliveries. Supports the development of ecommerce.
column41: Additional delivery costs and delays.

column3: Use vehicles suited for urban deliveries.
column4: Improving Last Mile Logistics (City Logistics)
column40: Reduces congestion and energy consumption. Reduces disruptions on local communities.
column41: Additional delivery costs and delays.
